verses.roman:
rāghave vasāñā dui kuṇḍī deoyāilā
rāghava dvividha ciḍā tāte bhijāilā

synonyms: rāghave—Rāghava Paṇḍita; vasāñā—making sit down; dui—two; kuṇḍī—earthen pots; deoyāilā—arranged to be delivered to him; rāghava—Rāghava Paṇḍita; dvi-vidha—two kinds; ciḍā—chipped rice; tāte—in them; bhijāilā—soaked.
translation: Lord Nityānanda made Rāghava Paṇḍita sit down and had two pots delivered to him also. There were two kinds of chipped rice soaked in them.
